{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3370082,"name":"Zach","username":"dogog","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/d/74df32/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-22T21:47:58.001Z","cooked":"

Looking for a reputable vendor for Victor SPs or any other similar motor controllers.
While I am excited for the launch of the Andymark Koors40, I’m unsure they will be released in time for the 2024 OCCRA season (October). For our past OCCRA seasons, we have been using Talon SR motor controllers. In the off-season, we realized Talon SRs are not allowed as per OCCRA’s rules. Another issue is that they’re huge when compared to other motor controllers. This led me to decide we should switch to Victor SPs, as they’re smaller and are allowed by OCCRA. Problem is, we only have six. That cuts it too close for comfort. We have stockpiles of Talon SRs, SRXs, and Victor SPXs, but OCCRA uses VEX V5. VEX V5 only supports PWM natively, which was why we used Talon SRs for so long.
Requirements for a replacement controller:
40A continuous
Less than $60/unit
Must be compatible with PWM
If anyone can find a vendor which sells Victor SPs, or any other motor controller which are similar, I would be very thankful. Local pickup is possible in Oakland County or Metro Detroit, MI.

*Edit: If you are part of an OCCRA team, please weigh in on your electrics system! I’d love to know what you ran in 2023.

dogog:

We have stockpiles of Talon SRs, SRXs, and Victor SPXs, but OCCRA uses VEX V5. VEX V5 only supports PWM natively, which was why we used Talon SRs for so long.

I’m unfamiliar with OCCRA rules, but the Talon SRX and Victor SPX can absolutely run in PWM mode if that gets you over the hump. https://store.ctr-electronics.com/content/user-manual/Talon%20SRX%20User’s%20Guide.pdf

I did not know this. I feel dumb now. Thank you. I see green and yellow wires and my caveman brain is not happy. I see black, red, and white wires and my caveman brain is very happy.
